events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate some outstanding debt.
The loan application was categorised under Personal Loan due to the mention of medical costs and debt consolidation in the submission.
Loan officer Jessica Reynolds was assigned to handle this personal loan application and initiate the review process.
The initial review confirmed that the application is complete, with the applicant requesting funds for medical bills and vacation plans.
Requested medical bills, employment verification, and recent bank statements to further evaluate the personal loan application.
Applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, including medical bills, employer letter, and detailed bank statements.
Credit check was completed with standard metrics, showing a moderate credit score that meets underwriting requirements.
Risk assessment evaluated the applicant’s ability to repay the loan given current income, debts, and credit history.
A loan offer outlining terms and repayment options was presented to the applicant for the requested personal loan amount.
The applicant responded with questions regarding interest rates and requested slight modifications to the repayment schedule.
Due to the applicant’s feedback, the case was escalated to senior underwriters for review of adjusted repayment terms.
After senior review, the personal loan was approved with revised repayment terms to accommodate the applicant’s requests.
The approved personal loan amount was successfully disbursed to the applicant’s bank account as requested.
Reached out to the applicant to confirm receipt of funds and to offer assistance with any questions about repayment.
The loan application case was formally closed following successful funding and the initial post-approval follow-up.
